intro: Penstemon laevigatus var. digitalis, commonly known as the digital penstemon, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It features tall, upright stems that produce striking blue to violet tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine white pubescence. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. This variety is known for its drought tolerance and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
